question: What is the Liquidation Fee?
answer: The Liquidation Fee is the percentage price another user needs to pay to buy the Liquidity Position. This fee is paid in any of the tokens in the Pool

question: When can I get Liquidated?
answer: Liquidations serve as a security mechanism in case the SOV token de-pegs from the value of Net-Asset-Value of the basket. Liquidations allow any user to withdraw liquidity on behalf of another user if they pay the liquidation fee to the original owner

question: Why can I not withdraw Assets with SOV bought on the secondary Markets?
answer: Liquidity Positions are bound to the users depositing into the basket. Only the users who minted the SOV can burn them again.

question: Why do I have 0 voting power even after depositing?
answer: To be more resilient to flashloan attacks Voting Power for Rebalancing is calculated at the end of each Epoch, you will see your Voting Power at the start of the next epoch

question: Why do I have 0 rewards even after depositing?
answer: Rewards are calculated at the end of each Epoch, you will see your Rewards at the start of the next epoch
